title: French Guiana - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 14 January 2021, in Cayenne, Cayenne, nearly 200 people protested against a curfew imposed as part of coronavirus measures and the lack of consultation ahead of coronavirus related measures such as the cancellation of the carnival. [size=nearly 200]
On 9 January 2021, in Cayenne, Cayenne, about 50 residents protested in front of the local prefecture against the curfew that is in place because of coronavirus. [size=about 50]

On 18 December 2020, in Cayenne, Cayenne, residents of the Cite Petit-Lucas neighbourhood protested against unsanitary conditions in the neighbourhood. They blocked several roads with car wrecks. [size=no report]

On 22 November 2020, in Cayenne, Cayenne, 150 people marched in the streets to support the leader of the Trop Violans movement who was sentenced to six months suspended jail sentence over allegedly assaulting a police officer. According to the protesters, the police officer instigated the fight. [size=150]
On 12 November 2020, in Charvein, Saint-Louis-du-Maroni, residents blocked the streets in protest against the lack of school transport in the region. [size=no report]
Labour Group (French Guiana); Health Workers (French Guiana)

On 18 September 2020, in Cayenne, Cayenne, about 30 employees of the local hospital protested against the work conditions. Longer shifts were recently implemented and the protesters think that this is unsustainable as there are not enough employees. [size=about 30]

On 25 July 2020, in Kourou, Cayenne, about 100 protesters marched in the streets to voice their discontent over the lack of security. Days before a firefighter was arrested for having beaten two individuals who he caught on his property. The protesters showed their support for this man. [size=about a hundred]

On 21 July 2020, in Cayenne, a hundred people demonstrated, holding up placards and burning tires and pallets. They were angry over the lack of action from the French government following promises made by the Prime Minister who visited Guyana on 12 July. [size=a hundred]
On 21 July 2020, in Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni, about 30 people mobilized to ask for better health care facilities in the department. [size=about 30]
On 17 July 2020, in Cayenne (Cayenne), protesters tried to invade the city hall to demand greater measures against the coronavirus crisis. [size=no report]

On 16 June 2020, in Cayenne, health workers mobilized in front of the Cayenne Hospital Center to protest against various measures, for more resources and renegotiation of wages. This was part of a protest movement organized throughout France. [size=no report]

On 4 June 2020, in Cayenne, a march was held to ask for justice in the case of the death of a woman who died under suspicious circumstances. As gatherings of more than ten people are not allowed because of COVID-19 many of the attendents remained in their cars. The mayor of Cayenne was part of the march. [size=no report]

On 3 June 2020, in Saint-Laurent-du Maroni, protesters gathered for a Black Lives Matter protest in solidarity with the protests taking place in the United States. Protesters burned American flags during the protest. [size=no report]

On 27 May 2020, in Cayenne, trade unions, associations and political parties protested in front of the Regional Health Agency of French Guiana to ask for certain measures to be implemented to combat the coronavirus. The protesters asked for widespread testing, free masks, access to water for all, obligatory masks in public spaces, the creation of a field hospital and availability of disinfectant in public buildings. [size=no report]
Police Forces of France (2017-) French Guiana
On 18 April 2020, in Cayenne, rioters threw bottles and stones at the police, and set fire to things. Police used tear gas to disperse the rioters. [size=no report]
Police Forces of France (2017-) French Guiana
On 1 April 2020, Remire-Montjoly, Cayenne, in the Remire Montjoli prison a riot broke out for unknown reasons. Police and military forces eventually calmed the riot. [size=no report

As reported on 30 March 2020, in the Kamuyeneh community near Macouria, members of the indigenous group that lives there blockaded the river Marroni to prevent illicit gold miners from entering the area. The gold miners have been exploiting the coronavirus crisis to expand their operations in the region. [size=no report]
On 25 March 2020, a curfew was imposed in French Guiana to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

Around 15 March 2020 (month of), in Talhuwen, Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni, members of the Wayana indigenous group protested against the increase in illicit exploitation of gold in the region. [size=no report]

On 25 December 2018, two journalists were filming in a suburb in Cayenne. They were beaten and robbed by young people. According to the International Association of Francophone Journalists, these events are not unusual.

On 13 December 2018, in Cayenne, Cayenne, students of the Universite de Guyane protested on campus over the announced increase in tuition fees for foreign students. Students say they will not be able to pay the fees. [size=no report]
On 13 December 2018, in Saint-Laurent-du Maroni, Saint-Laurent-du Maroni, parents of kindergarten students protested over an infestation of rats in the school's building. [size=no report]

On 13 December 2018, in Cayenne, Cayenne, employees of the real estate company SEMSAMAR protested at a road junction over uncertainty of their future while a meeting to decide over the company's future in French Guiana was held. [size=no report]

On 10 December 2018, in Cayenne, Cayenne, attorneys who have been on strike since November 30 protested in front of the prefectural hotel against a justice reform bill which was accepted by the Parliament. [size=no report]
On 20 November 2018, nurses protested in front of the city hall in Cayenne to demand their inclusion in the health reform of 2022.
UGT: General Union of Workers; Labour Group (French Guiana)
On 19 November 2018, workers' unions from EDF (French Electrics) demonstrated in Nelson Mandela Boulevard against their poor work conditions. The demonstrators burned objects during the protest.
On 17 November 2018, teachers from different schools protested in front of the rectorate as part of the national strike to demand more posts.

On 17 November 2018, members of the association Westerns Iguanas protested in the roads of Sain-Laurent against the rise in the prices of fuel using the vest of the Yellow Vest Movements. The police tried to maintain the regular flow of circulation on the roads. [size=no report]
On 16 November 2018, teachers from different schools protested in front of the rectorate as part of the national strike to demand more posts.
On 15 November 2018, teachers from different schools protested in front of the rectorate as part of the national strike to demand more posts.
On 14 November 2018, teachers from different schools protested in front of the rectorate as part of the national strike to demand more posts.
On 13 November 2018, teachers from different schools protested in front of the rectorate as part of the national strike to demand more posts.
On 12 November 2018, teachers from different schools protested in front of the rectorate in Cayenne as part of the national strike to demand more posts.
On 5 November 2018, students from Damas school in Remire-Montjoly protested to demand the adaptation of the school infrastructure for a schoolmate with disabilities.
Police Forces of France (2017-) French Guiana
On 17 October 2018, police officers protested in front of the police station in Cayenne to demand a support group for patrolling during nights.

On 25 September 2018, several squatters in Cayenne were ''persuaded'' to leave their shelter as hundreds of people demonstrated in front of it. Policemen were deployed to separate the protesters and the squatters.
On 25 September 2018, students from the Anne -Marie Javouhey school protested in front of the tribunals in Cayenne against the detention of some of their schoolmates due to visa problems.
On 24 September 2018, students from the Anne -Marie Javouhey school in Cayenne protested against the eviction of some of their schoolmates.
UNSA: National Union of Autonomous Trade Unions; Labour Group (French Guiana)

On 13 September 2018, workers from the Soul school in Macouria affiliated to the UNSA: National Union of Autonomous Trade Unions protested to demand improvements in their work conditions they marched from the market square to the rectorate.
Police Forces of France (2017-) French Guiana
On 6 September 2018, police officers protested in Cayenne their poor work conditions.

On 5 September 2018, a group of people attacked a settlement of foreigners in Cayenne to evict the occupants. Three people were injured in the attack. The police evicted the occupants and relocated them on the 25 of Sept after the attacks.

On 10 August 2018, a group of people gathered in the Sepelou hill near Cayenne to commemorate the autochthonous day and demand more representation of the natives in the society. Attendence was very low. The police were present during the activity without interrupting it. [size=no report]

On 25 July 2018, around 200 people, supported by the 500 Brothers organisation, protested in Cayenne to support the doctors that renounced their jobs after bringing to light the problems with health care.
On 13 July 2018, the right of housing association led a protest in Cayenne against a new article in the housing law that allows the eviction from and destruction of informal housing.
UGT: General Union of Workers; Labour Group (French Guiana)
On 3 July 2018, members of the UTG union blocked the way to prevent an airplane to take the CTG members from Grand-Santi until they did not achieve a solution for their demands.
UGT: General Union of Workers; Labour Group (French Guiana)
Police Forces of France (2017-) French Guiana

On 27 June 2018, workers affiliated to the UGT union from Cayenne's Hospitals protested against the poor conditions of the hospitals that have been worsened after the resignation of 17 doctors. The Police tried to block the access to the city hall.

On 21 June 2018, a group of people blocked the roads in Remire-Montjoly to protest against the housing law that permits the eviction of residents from illegal housing and the destruction of such housing.

On 8 June 2018, parents and students from the Taluen school in the Haute-Maroni region blocked the school in Taulen to, south of Maripasoula, to demonstrate against the lack of electricity and water service.

On 7 June 2018, parents and students from the Taluen school in the Haute-Maroni region blocked the school in Taulen to, south of Maripasoula, to demonstrate against the lack of electricity and water service.

On 6 June 2018, parents and students from the Taluen school in the Haute-Maroni region blocked the school in Taulen to, south of Maripasoula, to demonstrate against the lack of electricity and water service.

On 5 June 2018, parents and students from the Taluen school in the Haute-Maroni region blocked the school in Taulen to, south of Maripasoula, to demonstrate against the lack of electricity and water service.

On 4 June 2018, parents and students from the Taluen school in the Haute-Maroni region blocked the school in Taulen to, south of Maripasoula, to demonstrate against the lack of electricity and water service.
UGT: General Union of Workers; Labour Group (French Guiana)
On 22 May 2018, health, education, and other public services workers affiliated to the UGT protested in front of the city hall in Kourou to demand improvements in their work conditions.

On 10 May 2018, an armed person started a shooting in Cayenne against students from a commerce school that were having a meeting in the offices of the Guyanese Socialist Party. Several people were injured
On 4 May 2018, a group of women protested in front of the Cayenne's Hospital against the lack of doctors in Emergency after the renounce of 17 doctors.
On 28 March 2018, a group of people gathered by the Collective of Iguanas demonstrated in Saint-Laurent to express their intention to continue working on the 2017 issues.
On 28 March 2018, a group of people gathered by the 500 Brothers organisation marched in the roads of Cayenne to commemorate the ''Grand Marche'' of 28 Mar 2017.
On 6 March 2018, around 50 farmers protested in front of the Nutrition and Agricultural Direction in Cayenne to demand improvements in their work conditions.
On 6 February 2018, workers from schools and pupils' parents protested in Saint-Laurent-du-Maroni to demand more security to end school violence.
On 6 February 2018, more than 100 teachers from different schools protested in Cayenne against violence in the schools.
On 6 February 2018, around 30 school teachers protested in Kourou against violence in the schools.
Police Forces of France (2017-) French Guiana

On 4 February 2018, clashes erupted between some police officers and a group of youth as the police asked them to reduce the volume of their music. The group threw bottles and stones and the police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.
On 30 January 2018, a group of teachers from the Concorde school in Matoury marched to the City Hall to demand more security at the school.
On 30 January 2018, a group of school teachers in Saint-Laurent marched to the City Hall to demand more security at the school.
Police Forces of France (2017-) Prison Guards French Guiana
On 19 January 2018, guards from the Remire-Montjoly prison blocked the functioning of the prison to demand more security and improvements of their conditions.
